The RowStatTable panel

Source: R/panel_RowStatTable.R
RowStatTable-class.Rd

The RowStatTable is a panel class for creating a ColumnTable where the value of the table is defined as the rowData of the SummarizedExperiment.

Slot overview

This class inherits all slots from its parent ColumnTable and Table classes.

Constructor

RowStatTable(...) creates an instance of a RowStatTable class, where any slot and its value can be passed to ... as a named argument.

Note that ColSearch should be a character vector of length equal to the total number of columns in the rowData, though only the entries for the atomic fields will actually be used.

Contract description

The RowStatTable will provide user interface elements and observers to change all of its slots. The datatable is rendered with all atomic contents of the rowData of the SummarizedExperiment. Subclasses do not have to provide any methods, as this is a concrete class.

Supported methods

In the following code snippets, x is an instance of a RowStatTable class. Refer to the documentation for each method for more details on the remaining arguments.

For setting up data values:

  • .cacheCommonInfo(x) adds a "RowStatTable" entry containing valid.rowData.names, a character vector of names of atomic columns of the rowData. This will also call the equivalent ColumnTable method.

  • .refineParameters(x, se) adjusts ColSearch to a character vector of length equal to the number of atomic fields in the rowData. This will also call the equivalent ColumnTable method for further refinements to x.

For defining the interface:

  • .hideInterface(x, field) returns TRUE if field="DataBoxOpen", otherwise it calls .hideInterface,Table-method

  • .panelColor(x) will return the specified default color for this panel class.

For defining the panel name:

  • .fullName(x) will return "Row statistics table".

For creating the output:

  • .generateTable(x, envir) will modify envir to contain the relevant data.frame for display, while returning a character vector of commands required to produce that data.frame. Each row of the data.frame should correspond to a row of the SummarizedExperiment.

Examples

#################
# For end-users #
#################

x <- RowStatTable()
x[["Selected"]]
#> [1] NA
x[["Selected"]] <- "SOME_ROW_NAME"

##################
# For developers #
##################

library(scater)
sce <- mockSCE()

# Sets the search columns appropriately.
sce <- .cacheCommonInfo(x, sce)
.refineParameters(x, sce)
#> An object of class "RowStatTable"
#> Slot "Selected":
#> [1] "Gene_0001"
#> 
#> Slot "Search":
#> [1] ""
#> 
#> Slot "SearchColumns":
#> character(0)
#> 
#> Slot "PanelId":
#> [1] NA
#> 
#> Slot "PanelHeight":
#> [1] 500
#> 
#> Slot "PanelWidth":
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> Slot "SelectBoxOpen":
#> [1] FALSE
#> 
#> Slot "SelectRowSource":
#> [1] "---"
#> 
#> Slot "SelectColSource":
#> [1] "---"
#> 
#> Slot "DataBoxOpen":
#> [1] FALSE
#> 
#> Slot "SelectRowType":
#> [1] "Active"
#> 
#> Slot "SelectRowSaved":
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> Slot "SelectColType":
#> [1] "Active"
#> 
#> Slot "SelectColSaved":
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> Slot "MultiSelectHistory":
#> list()
#>
